name: St. Paul VI
summary: Pope Paul VI, born Giovanni Battista Montini, was head of the Catholic Church from 1963 until his death in 1978. He continued and concluded the Second Vatican Council begun by John XXIII and implemented its reforms. He was the first pope to travel extensively and made historic visits to the Holy Land, the United Nations, and other countries. He issued the encyclical Humanae Vitae.
keyQuotes: If you want peace, work for justice.
Somebody should have told us right at the start of our lives that we are dying. Then we might live life to the limit, every minute of every day.
